## 변호인

## 판결문 요약


DECISION AND ORDER
MYRON L. GORDON, District Judge.
This petition for habeas corpus challenging the validity of revocation of parole and *795the forfeiture of good time earned on sentences of imprisonment is before the court on the petitioner’s motion for judgment on the pleadings, pertinent portions of the record of the underlying state proceedings and the briefs of counsel.
The record shows that in April 1969, the petitioner was released from confinement in the Wisconsin state prison on parole from sentences imposed on two 1963 convictions for armed robbery. In May 1970, the petitioner’s parole was revoked pursuant to a recommendation by his parole agent and on July 1, 1970, the good time previously accrued on his sentences was ordered forfeited. The petitioner was not afforded a hearing prior to the revocation of parole or the forfeiture of good time.
The respondent does not dispute the petitioner’s contention that resort to the courts of the state of Wisconsin would be futile in light of the decisions in State ex rel. Johnson v. Cady, 50 Wis.2d 540, 185 N.W.2d 306 (1971), and Steele v. Gray, 64 Wis.2d 422, 219 N.W.2d 312, 223 N.W.2d 614 (1974), denying retroactive application of the rights of procedural due process there defined.
